ETYMOLOGY: From Old French helmet (diminutive of heaume 'helmet'), of Germanic origin; related to Old English helm 'protection'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A hard protective hat, worn for safety by soldiers, motorcyclists, cyclists, or other individuals in specific activities.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种坚硬的防护帽，由士兵、摩托车手、骑自行车者或其他在特定活动中的个人佩戴以确保安全。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It is compulsory to wear a helmet when riding a motorbike.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 骑摩托车时必须戴头盔。
